results.title: The Cat came back (K)
results.creator_credit: Cordell Barker, Ches Yetman, Richard Condie and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: Cordell Barker’s animated film is based on a century old folk song. Poor old Mr Johnson becomes increasingly manic as he tries and tries again to rid himself of a little yellow cat. His desperate attempts to find solitude become an obsession, with tragic consequences. Winner of the Special Jury Prize for Humor and Music at the 1988 World Festival of Animation in Zagreb. Fourteen awards, including Chicago; Shanghai; Quebec; Genie, Toronto; Oscar nomination.

results.title: The Cat came back
results.creator_credit: Cordell Barker, Richard Condie and ONF | NFB
results.brief_description: This hilarious animated short is based on the century-old folk song of the same name. Old Mr. Johnson makes increasingly manic attempts to rid himself of a little yellow cat that just won’t stay away.

results.title: The Cat and the fiddler
results.creator_credit: Jane Startz, Jeffrey Hayes, ACI Films and Thomas Sand Enterprises
results.brief_description: Tells the story of a travelling fiddler and his dancing cat whose performances earns a living for both of them. The king tries to buy the cat, however it will only dance for the fiddler. He plays but the court and the king cannot stop dancing. Based on the book by Jacky Jeter, illustrated by Lionel kalish. The original illustrations from the book are used in the film. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: The Cat and the collector
results.creator_credit: Morton Schindel and Weston Woods Studios
results.brief_description: A film which tells a story with drawings of how an old man befriends a stray cat and learns about the nature of cats. Based on the book of the same title written and illustrated by Linda Slovach. Narrated by Emery Battis. Suitable for primary school level.

results.title: The Cat = Il Gatto
results.creator_credit: Roberto Capanno, Michele Gandin and Radiotelevisione Italiana
results.brief_description: Scenes of Siamese kittens at play with commentary in Italian. Shows care of the kittens by mother cats at play and at feeding time. Child and adult alternate with commentary.

results.title: The Cat = A Macska (K)
results.creator_credit: Tibor Hernadi and MAFILM Pannonia Filmstudio
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Animalia”.
The protagonists of the film are two mice who are engaged in complicated scientific debate and keep arguing until they are unceremoniously swallowed by a cat. All things are relative.

results.title: The Cat's meow [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Peter Bogdanovich, Julie Baines, Dieter Meyer, Carol Lewis, Kim Bieber, Bieber + Lewis, Dan Films, CP Medien and Lions Gate Films
results.brief_description: Based on an old Hollywood rumour, “The Cat’s meow” is about William Randolph Hearst, the media magnate infamous in the 1920s for his power and wealth. In this story, “the whisper told most often” as one character puts it, the year is 1924 and Hearst’s private yacht is headed for San Diego, with a dozen guests, a mix of Hollywood power players and ambitious types, aboard. Amid the high profile travellers are Charlie Chaplin, gossip columnist Louella Parsons, actress, and Hearst’s long-term mistress, Marion Davies pioneering film producer and director Thomas Ince and acerbic novelist Elinor Glyn. As the ship sails, the intricate, and at times intimate, relationships between the players are placed under pressure by shifting power plays and the separate agendas of each character. Due to his legendary paranoia, Hearst has placed ‘bugs’ throughout the boat, enabling him to scrutinise, in particular, the relationship of Chaplin and Davies. The most interesting aspect of the film watching the larger than life Chaplin (deftly played by British comedian Eddie Izzard), operate not as a great artist, but as simply a man on the make. Hearst, depicted as a jealous and curmudgeonly buffoon, eavesdropping on his guests and girlfriend, trusting no one, is far more one-dimensional. Also of note is Kirsten Dunst who gives an infectiously joyous portrayal of Davies, a much-maligned comedian of her times. “The Cat’s meow” struggles as a murder mystery, but works well as a prism of 1920s Hollywood when the allure of stars like Chaplin was at a pinnacle, fed by an adoring public.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Peter Bogdanovich, Julie Baines, Dieter Meyer, Carol Lewis, Kim Bieber, Bieber + Lewis, Dan Films, CP Medien and Lions Gate Films

results.title: The Cat's meow
results.creator_credit: Oxford Scientific Films and National Geographic Society
results.brief_description: A live action cat-and-mouse story about several playful mice, an inquisitive house cat, and his cousin, the alley cat, which is shown as a serious struggle for survival and a comic standoff between lively opponents. Suitable for upper primary level.

results.title: The Castle of Adventure
results.creator_credit: Terry Marcel, Edward Francis and TVS Films
results.brief_description: Enid Blyton’s famous adventure story about five children, a sinister castle and a network of spies is brought vividly to life. A young widowed mother, takes her two children and friends to stay at a country cottage during the school holidays. They befriend a young gypsy girl who lives in the nearby woods. Across the valley, stand the dark, brooding remains of a mysterious ruined castle. The five children launch an expedition to discover the castle’s secrets.
